intro: Arabis holboellii var. tenuis, commonly known as narrow-leaved rock白菜, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves that are linear and often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. This variety is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
